comment.author: 51554137@N00
comment._content: Wystan The "troubles" typically refers to the time from the 1960s to 1990s. This photo [between ca. 1910 and ca. 1915], would have been taken in the run up to the 1916 Easter Rising.

comment.author: 7933842@N06
comment._content: "The Troubles" originally referred to the period 1919 to 1922 in Ireland, following on from the 1916 Rising.  It began to be used for the Northern Ireland conflict in the 1970s.

comment._content: the 1913 lockout,a period of street riots,and police brutality in dublin .may be the answer for this scene,as police escorts to coal deliveries and the trams etc' were commonplace, multitext.ucc.ie/d/Dublin_1913Strike_and_Lockout
